definition: to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]
to make up and go on stage (idiom); to embark on a career (esp. in politics or crime)

sentences.chinese: 左外锋，17岁就为曼联初次登场。

sentences.english: It could be a few months before they are ready for prime time.
sentences.chinese: 距离它们准备好登场可能还有几个月的时间。

sentences.english: The Yngling will make its Olympic debut in 2004.
sentences.chinese: 英灵级作为奥运会项目将在2004年首次登场。

sentences.english: My debut in the sixth-grade class production was a failure.
sentences.chinese: 我在六年级的初次登场就以失败告终。

sentences.english: If there’s a new Avatar, that means Aang has passed on.
sentences.chinese: 既然新神通登场，那就意味着安昂已经过世。

sentences.english: Liu Chuang and Liang Wenbo are making their debut in Sheffield this year, in fact.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，今年是刘闯和梁文博在谢菲尔德的首次登场。

sentences.english: The dancing was a bit straggly in the " London " routine .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦的例行表演中登场的那些舞者简直就是群丑跳梁。

sentences.english: Clarion is blowing, it's time for your monodrama.
Does that spell the end of a distinctive gay culture?
sentences.chinese: 这是否意味着卓尔不同的同志文化要粉墨登场呢。

sentences.english: Over the past years, the "problem foods" appeared one after another.
sentences.chinese: 这几年，问题食品像走马灯似的，你方唱罢我登场。

sentences.english: The relationship between the characters in Rasyoumonn is analyzed .
sentences.chinese: 从四个方面分析了《罗生门》中登场人物的相互关系。

sentences.english: And, white first, grow incarnadined, because.
sentences.chinese: 先是苍白，而后粉墨登场。

sentences.english: West Lake took hold of the hands of the blue sea. Monkey Lele staged a shinning debut in Cannes, France.
sentences.chinese: 西子湖牵手蔚蓝海岸，美猴乐乐闪亮登场法国戛纳。

sentences.english: Debut as a director through your MV "Bamboo Forest" how was that happen?
sentences.chinese: 在“竹林深处”中第一次做为导演登场，感觉如何？

sentences.english: Wherever life first flickered into being, it may have moved rapidly to occupy a wide range of environments.
sentences.chinese: 无论生命在哪里闪亮登场，都会迅即占据大片环境。
继伍德斯托克音乐节之后，多个大型集会登场。

definition: (of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
to begin/to open/to start/beginning of an event
everyone present/the whole audience/across-the-board/unanimously/whole duration (of a competition or match)
debut
first issue/first public showing
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
to compete/to take part (in a sports event)
to return to/to retreat/regression (statistics)
to go into battle
to come back out of retirement/to get involved again after having withdrawn
competition (sports etc)/match/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]/to compete
leading role/lead
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to do battle (with sb)
to arrest/to capture/to seize/to win (a set, a game etc)
